intro: Platylophus clemensiae, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of hairy texture. Platylophus clemensiae thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests and mountainous areas.
